Both files (skill-report.json and SKILL.md) are pure documentation with no scripts, network calls, or file operations. content.user_title: Manage LXC containers in Proxmox environments
content.value_statement: Proxmox container management involves complex GUI operations and manual coordination. This skill simplifies LXC container operations with intuitive commands for lifecycle management, monitoring, and resource optimization across your Proxmox cluster.
actual_capabilities: List containers on specific nodes with current status
Start, stop, reboot, and gracefully shutdown containers
Create new LXC containers with basic or advanced configuration
Clone existing containers for testing and deployment
Monitor container performance metrics and resource usage
Modify container resource allocation for CPU, memory, and storage
limitations: Requires Proxmox VE environment with LXC support enabled
Cannot manage Docker containers or Kubernetes clusters
Limited to Proxmox node operations within configured cluster

use_cases.description: Streamline container creation and management across Proxmox nodes without manual GUI operations

best_practices: Monitor container resource usage regularly to prevent over-allocation and performance degradation
Use graceful shutdown commands instead of immediate stops to avoid data corruption
Document container purposes and configurations for team visibility and troubleshooting
anti_patterns: Creating containers without resource limits can impact node performance and stability
Ignoring container logs makes troubleshooting difficult when issues arise
Running unnecessary services in containers wastes resources and increases attack surface

faq.question: Which Proxmox versions are compatible?
faq.answer: This skill works with Proxmox VE 6.x and later versions that support LXC containers.

faq.question: Can I manage Docker containers with this skill?
faq.answer: No, this skill is specifically for LXC containers in Proxmox environments only.

faq.question: Does it integrate with existing Proxmox clusters?
faq.answer: Yes, it operates on any node in your Proxmox cluster with appropriate API permissions.

faq.question: Is my container data safe during operations?
faq.answer: Yes, all operations use Proxmox APIs which maintain data integrity during container changes.

faq.question: What if a container fails to start?
faq.answer: Check container logs and resource allocation, then use reboot or diagnostic commands to recover.

faq.question: How does this compare to the Proxmox web UI?
faq.answer: Provides faster CLI-based management with automation capabilities for repetitive operational tasks.
